definition: Phanerozoic, geological eon lasting since the Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪[Han2 wu3 ji4], c. 540m year ago
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Two fundamentally different orogenic systems have existed on Earth throughout the Phanerozoic.
sentences.chinese: 地球上有兩套完全不同的造山系統一直存在於顯生宙。

sentences.english: These modes are the basic modes for the Phanerozoic continental growth of the continent of China.
sentences.chinese: 它們構成中國大陸顯生宙地殼生長的基本方式。

sentences.english: The tectonic nature of southern China has Changed again and again in the Phanerozoic.
sentences.chinese: 顯生宙期間，中國南部的構造屬性曾幾經轉化。

sentences.english: After the Sinian Great Ice Age, the Phanerozoic started.
sentences.chinese: 震旦紀大冰期後開始了顯生宙。
